intro: Limonium capense, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal areas. Limonium capense is known for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the year. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
